sdramc_example.c File Reference

Detailed Description

SDRAMC on EBI example application.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with an SDRAMC module can be used.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file sdramc_example.c.

#include "board.h"
#include "print_funcs.h"
#include "pm.h"
#include "sdramc.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

Functions

int main (void)
 Sets the SDRAM Controller up, initializes the SDRAM found on the board and tests it.

Function Documentation

Sets the SDRAM Controller up, initializes the SDRAM found on the board and tests it.

References SDRAM, SDRAM_SIZE, and sdramc_init().

00053 {
00054   unsigned long sdram_size, progress_inc, i, j, tmp, noErrors = 0;
00055   volatile unsigned long *sdram = SDRAM;
00056 
00057   // Switch to external oscillator 0.
00058   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00059 
00060   // Initialize the debug USART module.
00061   init_dbg_rs232(FOSC0);
00062 
00063   // Calculate SDRAM size in words (32 bits).
00064   sdram_size = SDRAM_SIZE >> 2;
00065   print_dbg("SDRAM size: ");
00066   print_dbg_ulong(SDRAM_SIZE >> 20);
00067   print_dbg(" MB\n");
00068 
00069   // Initialize the external SDRAM chip.
00070   sdramc_init(FOSC0);
00071   print_dbg("SDRAM initialized\n");
00072 
00073   // Determine the increment of SDRAM word address requiring an update of the
00074   // printed progression status.
00075   progress_inc = (sdram_size + 50) / 100;
00076 
00077   // Fill the SDRAM with the test pattern.
00078   for (i = 0, j = 0; i < sdram_size; i++)
00079   {
00080     if (i == j * progress_inc)
00081     {
00082       LED_Toggle(LED_BI0_RED);
00083       print_dbg("\rFilling SDRAM with test pattern: ");
00084       print_dbg_ulong(j++);
00085       print_dbg_char('%');
00086     }
00087     sdram[i] = i;
00088   }
00089   LED_Off(LED_BI0_RED);
00090   print_dbg("\rSDRAM filled with test pattern       \n");
00091 
00092   // Recover the test pattern from the SDRAM and verify it.
00093   for (i = 0, j = 0; i < sdram_size; i++)
00094   {
00095     if (i == j * progress_inc)
00096     {
00097       LED_Toggle(LED_BI0_GREEN);
00098       print_dbg("\rRecovering test pattern from SDRAM: ");
00099       print_dbg_ulong(j++);
00100       print_dbg_char('%');
00101     }
00102     tmp = sdram[i];
00103     if (tmp != i)
00104     {
00105       noErrors++;
00106     }
00107   }
00108   LED_Off(LED_BI0_GREEN);
00109   LED_On((noErrors) ? LED_BI1_RED : LED_BI1_GREEN);
00110   print_dbg("\rSDRAM tested: ");
00111   print_dbg_ulong(noErrors);
00112   print_dbg(" corrupted word(s)       \n");
00113 
00114   while (1);
00115 }
